definitions.definition: A rest or support, as for the hand, a tool, or a piece of work.
To stabilize something; to prevent from shaking.
Firm in standing or position; not tottering or shaking; fixed; firm.
definitions.example: Hold the ladder steady while I go up.

definitions.definition: Constant in feeling, purpose, or pursuit; not fickle, changeable, or wavering; not easily moved or persuaded to alter a purpose; resolute.
definitions.example: a man steady in his principles, in his purpose, or in the pursuit of an object

definitions.definition: Smooth and not bumpy or with obstructions.

definitions.example: the steady course of the Sun;  a steady breeze of wind

definitions.definition: To row with pressure at a low stroke-rating, often 18 strokes per minute.
definitions.example: After the sprint pieces, we rowed steady for the rest of practice.
